Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Appeal Division (RAD) erred in applying the standard of reasonableness when reviewing the Refugee Protection Division's (RPD) decision
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to family persecution following a coup in Mali
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected the claim; RAD initially upheld the decision but did so using an incorrect legal standard
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the RAD's decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review is allowed; matter remitted to RAD for reconsideration with a newly constituted panel
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on family affiliation after a political coup in Mali
Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Procedural_Issue: RAD improperly treated RPD's decision as subject to judicial review rather than conducting an appeal
Credibility_Assessment: Affected by the RAD's incorrect application of legal standards
Application_Basis: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: New evidence regarding family persecution in Mali
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and remittal for proper appeal hearing
Governing_Rule: Under subsection 72(1) of IRPA, judicial review may be sought where there is an error in law or procedure
Outcome: Judicial review granted; case remitted to RAD
Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicant faced persecution due to family ties after a coup in Mali
Evidence_Handling: Improper consideration of new evidence due to misapplication of review standard
Evidence_Issues: Failure to properly assess new evidence under correct appeal standards
Evidence_Assessment: RAD failed to independently assess credibility and evidence under proper appeal framework
Decision_Rationale: RAD incorrectly applied reasonableness standard akin to judicial review instead of conducting a de novo appeal
Evidentiary_Issues: Inadequate evaluation of new evidence due to procedural error
